issue.title: Fix #207458 webhosting.systems
issue.body:
# Creating the pull request

Login to the plesk instance for the company [netcup](https://www.netcup.com) was not possible.
I added an allowlist rule that allows login again.

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

Incorrect removal of PHPSESSID url param

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [x] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/207458

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Your comment

When using netcup auto login from within their portal, the session got stripped and I was being redirected to the login page instead of being auto-logged-in.

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1: Previous redirect to login page</summary>

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b16029dc-b3e2-4fe6-8ee4-ac2619e6cad8)

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 2: After the fix it logs me in like intended</summary>

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4518ef55-2122-4fce-9738-50c324933ef4)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body: Hi, looks like `.php?$removeparam=PHPSESSID` is not a safe rule. Can you remove that rule instead of making a new exceptions?

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

issue.title: Update this rule
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Rule in filter does not cover scripts from some websites.

### Proposed solution

Update this rule below to also cover scripts from these websites.

! Cloudflare
`/\/(public|resources|static|assets)\/([a-f0-9]){28,31}$/$script,xmlhttprequest,~third-party`

`www.etihad.com/en-us/` - not blocked
`www.etihad.com/static/90d5b016a2af8b618379df637e4ebf3ab46d0014f023a4` < 46 chars long

`www.indigo.ca` - not blocked
`www.indigo.ca/static/cf14ea1b21fced9cf31673656f60ccd3ae553baf0fff9d` < 46 chars long

`www.kroger.com` - previously blocked in #196966
`www.kroger.com/resources/3928988eb503cb204a2ba5ee8d0c2be4f278e07179439` < 45 chars long

`www.lowes.com` - previously blocked in #197126
`www.lowes.com/resources/1bffdb32427933b339c1266885d50364a1c78de092b14` < 45 chars long

`www.pearson.com` - previously blocked in #197260
`www.pearson.com/assets/ad364aa749167f794e266452faa1fa11422373f0727` < 43 chars long

`www.abs-cbn.com` - already blocked in uBlock Privacy
`www.abs-cbn.com/resources/78666a6ca0480f402aa286220b9a4e474f80016460894` < 45 chars long

### Additional information

These scripts send telemetry to first party, wait about ten seconds after page has loaded then navigate to another page. If you update this rule, you can also remove the following rules below since they will no longer be needed.

`||kroger.com/resources/*/collect`
`||lowes.com/resources/*/collect?`
`||pearson.com/assets/*/collect`

comment.body:
@Yuki2718 Maybe using `header` like suggested at https://github.com/Yuki2718/adblock/issues/45 ?

```adb
/^https:\/\/[^\/]+\/assets\/[a-f0-9]{43,46}$/$script,1p,strict1p,match-case,header=content-md5
/^https:\/\/[^\/]+\/public\/[a-f0-9]{43,46}$/$script,1p,strict1p,match-case,header=content-md5
/^https:\/\/[^\/]+\/resources\/[a-f0-9]{43,46}$/$script,1p,strict1p,match-case,header=content-md5
/^https:\/\/[^\/]+\/static\/[a-f0-9]{43,46}$/$script,1p,strict1p,match-case,header=content-md5
```

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
I tried testing other safari content blockers and asked who can reproduce on X.
I tried using "AdBlock Pro", "Adblock plus", "AdLock blocker", "AdBlocker,"1Blocker".
No extention that I listed above caused any issues on the page and the issue occurs just only turning on the top button of AdGuard , but only page reloading or delay of displaying were seen.

I found a website that crashes very easily by using AdGuard ,but it crashes without using any extension(it was the same on Brave ,but the frequency is lower). 
It is more crashable when using AdGuard but my device did not get hot and delay of displaynig did not happen.
I cannot understand their differences.
url: https://www.openrec.tv/user/yaritaiji

By the way, thank you for helping me try to find people who can reproduce it by reposting my post.

issue.title: *-datareceiver.aki-game.net

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard DNS

### AdGuard version

n/a

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

the problem is with app, not a site

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

Wuthering waves

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

_No response_

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

AdGuard DNS filter

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

In game "Wuthering waves", which is downloadable [here](https://wutheringwaves.kurogames.com/), there is a tracker `*-datareceiver.aki-game.net`. Asterisk means the region where player is playing the game. At main menu the collected system and hardware info is sent to `us-datareceiver.aki-game.net` but when I selected Europe region and started playing, domain changed to `eu-datareceiver.aki-game.net`. That means that there are domains for other regions too. So, the rule I recommend is:

`||*-datareceiver.aki-game.net^`

Data is sent in short regular intervals in POST requests and is gzip compressed.

Game is free but requires an account, you can link other accounts, so you can test this yourself. Game is also available for Android and iOS.


Adguard DNS is set up in my system settings, I'm _**not**_ using [Adguard private dns](https://adguard-dns.io/)

### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
This is the information I have at the moment(I have no idea what more to investigate about the condition. I'm sorry for my ignorance ):
・This issue occurs even if only enabling advanced protection(crashing will decrease).
・This issue seems to be an iOS-specific issue and only occurs when enabling AdGuard's advanced protection
   (No other extension as far as I tested cause this issue)
   (It only occurs when visiting the site with safari,won't occurs on my laptop with using AdGuard app or extension)
・The contents of the rules which is included in the advanced protection have nothing to do with the issue ,but the number of the            
    rules which the advanced protection contains is related to the issue. 
・Brave or other browsers appealing ad blocking on iOS (as far as I tested) did not cause this issue. (e.g. Opera GX,Firefox focus)
・There are some other websites that crash ,but the issue differs.
    For example,Rakuten consumes my device's resources(may include CPU and battery) radically, whereas Openrec may only   
    consume memory.

issue.title: Fix #207458 webhosting.systems
issue.body:
# Creating the pull request

Login to the plesk instance for the company [netcup](https://www.netcup.com) was not possible.
I added an allowlist rule that allows login again.

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

Incorrect removal of PHPSESSID url param

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [x] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/207458

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Your comment

When using netcup auto login from within their portal, the session got stripped and I was being redirected to the login page instead of being auto-logged-in.

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1: Previous redirect to login page</summary>

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b16029dc-b3e2-4fe6-8ee4-ac2619e6cad8)

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 2: After the fix it logs me in like intended</summary>

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4518ef55-2122-4fce-9738-50c324933ef4)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
> I found a website that crashes very easily by using AdGuard ,but it crashes without using any extension(it was the same on Brave ,but the frequency is lower). It is more crashable when using AdGuard but my device did not get hot and delay of displaynig did not happen. I cannot understand their differences. url: https://www.openrec.tv/user/yaritaiji
> 

This part is a bit confusing, I guess you're referring another website `www.openrec.tv` and the crash on Rakuten still never happens if without AG + Advanced protection, right? If so, let's focus only on the issue on Rakuten. Can you open an issue on https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForiOS/issues ?

```
||html-load.com^

```

issue.title: Update this rule
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Rule in filter does not cover scripts from some websites.

### Proposed solution

Update this rule below to also cover scripts from these websites.

! Cloudflare
`/\/(public|resources|static|assets)\/([a-f0-9]){28,31}$/$script,xmlhttprequest,~third-party`

`www.etihad.com/en-us/` - not blocked
`www.etihad.com/static/90d5b016a2af8b618379df637e4ebf3ab46d0014f023a4` < 46 chars long

`www.indigo.ca` - not blocked
`www.indigo.ca/static/cf14ea1b21fced9cf31673656f60ccd3ae553baf0fff9d` < 46 chars long

`www.kroger.com` - previously blocked in #196966
`www.kroger.com/resources/3928988eb503cb204a2ba5ee8d0c2be4f278e07179439` < 45 chars long

`www.lowes.com` - previously blocked in #197126
`www.lowes.com/resources/1bffdb32427933b339c1266885d50364a1c78de092b14` < 45 chars long

`www.pearson.com` - previously blocked in #197260
`www.pearson.com/assets/ad364aa749167f794e266452faa1fa11422373f0727` < 43 chars long

`www.abs-cbn.com` - already blocked in uBlock Privacy
`www.abs-cbn.com/resources/78666a6ca0480f402aa286220b9a4e474f80016460894` < 45 chars long

### Additional information

These scripts send telemetry to first party, wait about ten seconds after page has loaded then navigate to another page. If you update this rule, you can also remove the following rules below since they will no longer be needed.

`||kroger.com/resources/*/collect`
`||lowes.com/resources/*/collect?`
`||pearson.com/assets/*/collect`

comment.body:
`content-md5` is actually quite rare for scripts if I'm not wrong.

About `/collect?t=` I think it looks like XHR but I need to check again too.

issue.title: Update this rule
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Rule in filter does not cover scripts from some websites.

### Proposed solution

Update this rule below to also cover scripts from these websites.

! Cloudflare
`/\/(public|resources|static|assets)\/([a-f0-9]){28,31}$/$script,xmlhttprequest,~third-party`

`www.etihad.com/en-us/` - not blocked
`www.etihad.com/static/90d5b016a2af8b618379df637e4ebf3ab46d0014f023a4` < 46 chars long

`www.indigo.ca` - not blocked
`www.indigo.ca/static/cf14ea1b21fced9cf31673656f60ccd3ae553baf0fff9d` < 46 chars long

`www.kroger.com` - previously blocked in #196966
`www.kroger.com/resources/3928988eb503cb204a2ba5ee8d0c2be4f278e07179439` < 45 chars long

`www.lowes.com` - previously blocked in #197126
`www.lowes.com/resources/1bffdb32427933b339c1266885d50364a1c78de092b14` < 45 chars long

`www.pearson.com` - previously blocked in #197260
`www.pearson.com/assets/ad364aa749167f794e266452faa1fa11422373f0727` < 43 chars long

`www.abs-cbn.com` - already blocked in uBlock Privacy
`www.abs-cbn.com/resources/78666a6ca0480f402aa286220b9a4e474f80016460894` < 45 chars long

### Additional information

These scripts send telemetry to first party, wait about ten seconds after page has loaded then navigate to another page. If you update this rule, you can also remove the following rules below since they will no longer be needed.

`||kroger.com/resources/*/collect`
`||lowes.com/resources/*/collect?`
`||pearson.com/assets/*/collect`

comment.body:
`content-md5` is actually quite rare for scripts if I'm not wrong.

About `/collect?t=` I think it looks like XHR but I need to check again too.

That isn't safer. `/collect?t=` sounds safer path, but somehow I can't reproduce.

issue.title: chipotle.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://chipotle.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fchipotle.com) ### Comment > AdGuard DNS server being on results in the Chipotle app getting stuck on the loading screen when signed in to the Chipotle app. The App loads when not signed in or DNS protection is off. issue.title: Update this rule
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Rule in filter does not cover scripts from some websites.

### Proposed solution

Update this rule below to also cover scripts from these websites.

! Cloudflare
`/\/(public|resources|static|assets)\/([a-f0-9]){28,31}$/$script,xmlhttprequest,~third-party`

`www.etihad.com/en-us/` - not blocked
`www.etihad.com/static/90d5b016a2af8b618379df637e4ebf3ab46d0014f023a4` < 46 chars long

`www.indigo.ca` - not blocked
`www.indigo.ca/static/cf14ea1b21fced9cf31673656f60ccd3ae553baf0fff9d` < 46 chars long

`www.kroger.com` - previously blocked in #196966
`www.kroger.com/resources/3928988eb503cb204a2ba5ee8d0c2be4f278e07179439` < 45 chars long

`www.lowes.com` - previously blocked in #197126
`www.lowes.com/resources/1bffdb32427933b339c1266885d50364a1c78de092b14` < 45 chars long

`www.pearson.com` - previously blocked in #197260
`www.pearson.com/assets/ad364aa749167f794e266452faa1fa11422373f0727` < 43 chars long

`www.abs-cbn.com` - already blocked in uBlock Privacy
`www.abs-cbn.com/resources/78666a6ca0480f402aa286220b9a4e474f80016460894` < 45 chars long

### Additional information

These scripts send telemetry to first party, wait about ten seconds after page has loaded then navigate to another page. If you update this rule, you can also remove the following rules below since they will no longer be needed.

`||kroger.com/resources/*/collect`
`||lowes.com/resources/*/collect?`
`||pearson.com/assets/*/collect`

comment.body:
`content-md5` is actually quite rare for scripts if I'm not wrong.

About `/collect?t=` I think it looks like XHR but I need to check again too.

issue.title: Update this rule
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Rule in filter does not cover scripts from some websites.

### Proposed solution

Update this rule below to also cover scripts from these websites.

! Cloudflare
`/\/(public|resources|static|assets)\/([a-f0-9]){28,31}$/$script,xmlhttprequest,~third-party`

`www.etihad.com/en-us/` - not blocked
`www.etihad.com/static/90d5b016a2af8b618379df637e4ebf3ab46d0014f023a4` < 46 chars long

`www.indigo.ca` - not blocked
`www.indigo.ca/static/cf14ea1b21fced9cf31673656f60ccd3ae553baf0fff9d` < 46 chars long

`www.kroger.com` - previously blocked in #196966
`www.kroger.com/resources/3928988eb503cb204a2ba5ee8d0c2be4f278e07179439` < 45 chars long

`www.lowes.com` - previously blocked in #197126
`www.lowes.com/resources/1bffdb32427933b339c1266885d50364a1c78de092b14` < 45 chars long

`www.pearson.com` - previously blocked in #197260
`www.pearson.com/assets/ad364aa749167f794e266452faa1fa11422373f0727` < 43 chars long

`www.abs-cbn.com` - already blocked in uBlock Privacy
`www.abs-cbn.com/resources/78666a6ca0480f402aa286220b9a4e474f80016460894` < 45 chars long

### Additional information

These scripts send telemetry to first party, wait about ten seconds after page has loaded then navigate to another page. If you update this rule, you can also remove the following rules below since they will no longer be needed.

`||kroger.com/resources/*/collect`
`||lowes.com/resources/*/collect?`
`||pearson.com/assets/*/collect`

comment.body:
`content-md5` is actually quite rare for scripts if I'm not wrong.

About `/collect?t=` I think it looks like XHR but I need to check again too.

issue.title: notube.net (cdn.notube.net)
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Content Blocker, AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

Adguard for Brave

issue.title: Update this rule
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Rule in filter does not cover scripts from some websites.

### Proposed solution

Update this rule below to also cover scripts from these websites.

! Cloudflare
`/\/(public|resources|static|assets)\/([a-f0-9]){28,31}$/$script,xmlhttprequest,~third-party`

`www.etihad.com/en-us/` - not blocked
`www.etihad.com/static/90d5b016a2af8b618379df637e4ebf3ab46d0014f023a4` < 46 chars long

`www.indigo.ca` - not blocked
`www.indigo.ca/static/cf14ea1b21fced9cf31673656f60ccd3ae553baf0fff9d` < 46 chars long

`www.kroger.com` - previously blocked in #196966
`www.kroger.com/resources/3928988eb503cb204a2ba5ee8d0c2be4f278e07179439` < 45 chars long

`www.lowes.com` - previously blocked in #197126
`www.lowes.com/resources/1bffdb32427933b339c1266885d50364a1c78de092b14` < 45 chars long

`www.pearson.com` - previously blocked in #197260
`www.pearson.com/assets/ad364aa749167f794e266452faa1fa11422373f0727` < 43 chars long

`www.abs-cbn.com` - already blocked in uBlock Privacy
`www.abs-cbn.com/resources/78666a6ca0480f402aa286220b9a4e474f80016460894` < 45 chars long

### Additional information

These scripts send telemetry to first party, wait about ten seconds after page has loaded then navigate to another page. If you update this rule, you can also remove the following rules below since they will no longer be needed.

`||kroger.com/resources/*/collect`
`||lowes.com/resources/*/collect?`
`||pearson.com/assets/*/collect`

comment.body:
`content-md5` is actually quite rare for scripts if I'm not wrong.

About `/collect?t=` I think it looks like XHR but I need to check again too.

`www.pearson.com` - previously blocked in #197260
`www.pearson.com/assets/ad364aa749167f794e266452faa1fa11422373f0727` < 43 chars long

`www.abs-cbn.com` - already blocked in uBlock Privacy
`www.abs-cbn.com/resources/78666a6ca0480f402aa286220b9a4e474f80016460894` < 45 chars long

### Additional information

These scripts send telemetry to first party, wait about ten seconds after page has loaded then navigate to another page. If you update this rule, you can also remove the following rules below since they will no longer be needed.

`||kroger.com/resources/*/collect`
`||lowes.com/resources/*/collect?`
`||pearson.com/assets/*/collect`

comment.body:
>  Maybe using `header` like suggested at [Yuki2718/adblock#45](https://github.com/Yuki2718/adblock/issues/45) ?

That isn't safer. `/collect?t=` sounds safer path, but somehow I can't reproduce.

issue.title: Update this rule
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Rule in filter does not cover scripts from some websites.

### Proposed solution

issue.title: Update this rule
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Rule in filter does not cover scripts from some websites.

### Proposed solution

Update this rule below to also cover scripts from these websites.

! Cloudflare
`/\/(public|resources|static|assets)\/([a-f0-9]){28,31}$/$script,xmlhttprequest,~third-party`

`www.etihad.com/en-us/` - not blocked
`www.etihad.com/static/90d5b016a2af8b618379df637e4ebf3ab46d0014f023a4` < 46 chars long

`www.indigo.ca` - not blocked
`www.indigo.ca/static/cf14ea1b21fced9cf31673656f60ccd3ae553baf0fff9d` < 46 chars long

`www.kroger.com` - previously blocked in #196966
`www.kroger.com/resources/3928988eb503cb204a2ba5ee8d0c2be4f278e07179439` < 45 chars long

`www.lowes.com` - previously blocked in #197126
`www.lowes.com/resources/1bffdb32427933b339c1266885d50364a1c78de092b14` < 45 chars long

`www.pearson.com` - previously blocked in #197260
`www.pearson.com/assets/ad364aa749167f794e266452faa1fa11422373f0727` < 43 chars long

`www.abs-cbn.com` - already blocked in uBlock Privacy
`www.abs-cbn.com/resources/78666a6ca0480f402aa286220b9a4e474f80016460894` < 45 chars long

### Additional information

These scripts send telemetry to first party, wait about ten seconds after page has loaded then navigate to another page. If you update this rule, you can also remove the following rules below since they will no longer be needed.

`||kroger.com/resources/*/collect`
`||lowes.com/resources/*/collect?`
`||pearson.com/assets/*/collect`

comment.body:
`content-md5` is actually quite rare for scripts if I'm not wrong.

About `/collect?t=` I think it looks like XHR but I need to check again too.

issue.title: Update this rule
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Rule in filter does not cover scripts from some websites.

### Proposed solution

Update this rule below to also cover scripts from these websites.

! Cloudflare
`/\/(public|resources|static|assets)\/([a-f0-9]){28,31}$/$script,xmlhttprequest,~third-party`

`www.etihad.com/en-us/` - not blocked
`www.etihad.com/static/90d5b016a2af8b618379df637e4ebf3ab46d0014f023a4` < 46 chars long

`www.indigo.ca` - not blocked
`www.indigo.ca/static/cf14ea1b21fced9cf31673656f60ccd3ae553baf0fff9d` < 46 chars long

`www.kroger.com` - previously blocked in #196966
`www.kroger.com/resources/3928988eb503cb204a2ba5ee8d0c2be4f278e07179439` < 45 chars long

`www.lowes.com` - previously blocked in #197126
`www.lowes.com/resources/1bffdb32427933b339c1266885d50364a1c78de092b14` < 45 chars long

`www.pearson.com` - previously blocked in #197260
`www.pearson.com/assets/ad364aa749167f794e266452faa1fa11422373f0727` < 43 chars long

`www.abs-cbn.com` - already blocked in uBlock Privacy
`www.abs-cbn.com/resources/78666a6ca0480f402aa286220b9a4e474f80016460894` < 45 chars long

### Additional information

These scripts send telemetry to first party, wait about ten seconds after page has loaded then navigate to another page. If you update this rule, you can also remove the following rules below since they will no longer be needed.

`||kroger.com/resources/*/collect`
`||lowes.com/resources/*/collect?`
`||pearson.com/assets/*/collect`

comment.body:
`content-md5` is actually quite rare for scripts if I'm not wrong.

About `/collect?t=` I think it looks like XHR but I need to check again too.

comment.body:
>  Maybe using `header` like suggested at [Yuki2718/adblock#45](https://github.com/Yuki2718/adblock/issues/45) ?

That isn't safer. `/collect?t=` sounds safer path, but somehow I can't reproduce.
